name: vscode-mocha-test-adapter
description: Run your Mocha tests in the Sidebar of Visual Studio Code
author: Holger Benl <hbenl@evandor.de>

scripts.build: npm run build-extension && npm run build-worker
scripts.rebuild: npm run clean && npm run build

mochaExplorer.files.description: The glob(s) describing the location of your test files (relative to the workspace folder)

mochaExplorer.pruneFiles.description: Only load the test files needed for the current test run (the default is to load all configured files)

mochaExplorer.env.description: Environment variables to be set when running the tests

mochaExplorer.envPath.description: Path to a dotenv file (relative to the workspace folder) containing environment variables to be set when running the tests

mochaExplorer.cwd.description: The working directory where mocha is run (relative to the workspace folder)

mochaExplorer.ui.description: The mocha ui used by the tests

mochaExplorer.retries.description: The number of times to retry failed tests

mochaExplorer.exit.description: Shutdown the Mocha process (using process.exit()) after the last test has been run

mochaExplorer.optsFile.description: The location of the mocha.opts file (relative to the workspace folder). If you set this option, the mocha.opts file will be parsed using a legacy parser and all other mocha configuration files will be ignored. Otherwise, all mocha configuration files will be parsed using mocha's parser.

mochaExplorer.nodePath.description: The path to the node executable to use. By default it will attempt to find it on your PATH, if it can't find it or if this option is set to `null`, it will use the one shipped with VS Code

mochaExplorer.mochaPath.description: The path to the mocha package to use (relative to the workspace folder). By default (or if this option is set to `null`) it uses a bundled version of mocha, to use the one installed in your project's node_modules folder, set this option to "node_modules/mocha"

mochaExplorer.monkeyPatch.description: Apply a monkey patch to Mocha's `bdd`, `tdd` and `qunit` interfaces to get more accurate line numbers for the tests and suites

mochaExplorer.debuggerPort.description: The port to use for debugging sessions

mochaExplorer.debuggerConfig.description: The name of a launch configuration to use for debugging sessions

mochaExplorer.esmLoader.description: Use Mocha's experimental ESM module loader if it is available

mochaExplorer.launcherScript.description: The path of a launcher script (relative to the workspace folder) used for running the tests remotely

mochaExplorer.ipcRole.description: Use a TCP connection instead of Node's IPC mechanism for talking to worker processes. This is only needed with some launcher scripts.

mochaExplorer.ipcPort.description: The TCP port that worker processes use to send their results to VS Code if `mochaExplorer.ipcRole` is set

mochaExplorer.ipcHost.description: The TCP host used for communication with worker processes. If `mochaExplorer.ipcRole` is set to `client`, this is the address that Mocha Explorer tries to connect to, if it is set to `server`, this is the address on which Mocha Explorer will listen for a connection.

mochaExplorer.autoload.description: Automatically (re)load the tests when source files or relevant settings are changed and/or when VS Code is started

mochaExplorer.logpanel.description: Write diagnostic logs to an output panel

mochaExplorer.logfile.description: Write diagnostic logs to the given file

commands.title: Mocha Test Explorer: Enable for a workspace folder
Mocha Test Explorer: Disable for a workspace folder
